column1: Folate deficiency means you have a lower-than-normal amount of folic acid, a type of vitamin B, in your blood.
Because folate is not stored in the body in large amounts, your blood levels will get low after only a few weeks of eating a diet low in folate.
Folate deficiency can be diagnosed with a blood test.

Complications include: - Anemia (low red blood cell count) - Low levels of white blood cells and platelets (in severe cases) In folate-deficiency anemia, the red blood cells are abnormally large (megaloblastic).
Women who may become pregnant should take folic acid supplements to ensure that they get enough each day.
